website_summaries.verdict: The pricey Klipsch Image in-ear headphones combine rich sound with superior comfort.
pros: excellent sound quality with strong bass
include pocket storage case and larger zippered carrying case

customer_reviews.title: Selling Fake Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these from World Class Inc. Ive owned two pairs before, and these were clearly fake. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Gondolli

customer_reviews.title: X10: even more perfect than perfect S4
customer_reviews.text: I used to be die-hard Sony fan and still respect their headphones and earphones. However, after two sets of S4's (for convenience sake), I became solid fan of Klipsch and had no hesitancy trying the X10's. 10's have everything that makes the 4's great plus unbeatable sound, comfortable wear for hours, weightless, cables that are perfect in 4's but even lighter weight and possibly more durable in 10's. After several months of using both daily, the 4's and 10's are great purchases at their price points. My newest baseline for total value and earphone performance is the X10 and I don't anticipate a competitor raising that bar anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Alamo

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these three years ago, tried to like them but just didn't happen. Let me say first, I’m a big fan of klipsch speakers but their earphones are another story. I hardly ever use my x10s, just stored away. The sound is flat but grainy. Comfort is below average, I can never wear them for more than 30 minutes before they become uncomfortable. Yes, I can get premium ear tips, but still the sound IS disappointing. There are better earphones out there at half the price. Skip these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice IEM's at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these when they went on sale because of being discontinued for a model with controls on the cable. I have used other Klipsch modes in the past and have liked them. I also use a set of very nice Shure IEM's. These Klipsch are very well behaved and have a very neutral sound. Not exagerated bass like some IEM's, and a smooth balanced mid range. I enjoy using them . I would not have purchased them at the regular price but I was glad to take a chance at the discounted price and I'm glad I did. I do not like the supplied tips but they sound great seal well with Comply T tips.
customer_reviews.author: Marc McCord

customer_reviews.title: Quickly Becoming A Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I do all my headphone listening on portable players. My media is digital and lossless. I use an iDevice with either an amp or dac/amp. The Klipsch Image X10's are very easy to seat in the ear. Unlike other in-ear headphone I own (Shure 535's or UE 10's), the X10's can readily be taken out and then re-seated in the ear. Even after several hours of listening, they are still very comfortable. They don't tug on the ear and keep a good fit when moving around. Their ability to isolate are the second best I own. The only better isolating headphones are my Ety 4's with triple flanges. They are a very comfortable headphone for day to day commuting.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: FAKE! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: 100% Fake. I own another pair of klipsch x10 and did a comparison to the one I just purchased. The audio quality was shockingly poor. I bought this from the seller Skull Candy. Other sellers might be doing this as well. Please take caution. Things to check: 1. The box should have a silver hologram sticker with a serial number on it . 2. You can check the serial number on Klipsch website:  Having said that, the actual Klispsch X10 are very good in clarity and maybe a bit heavy on the bass. But they are incredibly comfortable and I hardly notice them after a while. Happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Amit Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Earbud Shape
customer_reviews.text: Lovely sound, fit perfect and don't give me a headache which is generally a problem. They are light with sturdy metal speakers attached to super comfortable silicone earpieces! That fit wonderfully. Blocks out sound but not so much someone talking loud right in front of you. The cord is concerning. I like the right angle hook in but the cable itself is very thin and if moving you hear the cord noise. I wouldn't recommend these for running and if I were rough on electronics these would break quickly. For my occasional gaming, work, and meditation use they are perfect very high quality sound with a compact protective case.
customer_reviews.author: NursePicky

customer_reviews.title: Best earbuds owned
customer_reviews.text: Free ad for a product I love: Klipsch X10 ear buds. I've had a pair for years and when mine broke recently and I had to go without them for a week I realized how much. I own $650 headphones and $5k speakers but these tiny $125 earbuds are my favorites. Fantastic isolation, too - can't hear my lawnmower or a helicopter landing nearby. Excellent warranty service, super light, and they fit perfectly - I can mow for hours without adjusting. If you love music or know someone who does give these a listen.
customer_reviews.author: JustDave1

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding ear buds!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding ear bud!!! One of the best I've tried. Most of the ear buds only last about six months before they have problems, so, I brought the 3 year square trade protection plan. I don't normally purchase insurance for products, but, knowing how delicate most of the ear buds are I felt it was a smart idea to get protection on this pair. These ear buds sound is fantastic! I've had them for four months without any issues. I'll try and revisit my feedback once I see the long term durability of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Honest-Jane

customer_reviews.title: Beware!  High price, low quality.
customer_reviews.text: Way too expensive – I paid $270.00 from Amazon. I've had mine two and a half years and the rubber collar on the connecting pin came unloose exposing the tiny wires. I've always treated this headset with extreme care but then this happens. When I contacted Klipsch, they were completely unsympathetic and unwilling to stand behind their product. I asked if I could pay them to repair the headset but they don't offer repairs. I was essentially told "tough luck". I've always viewed Klipsch as a quality company that sells quality products but this experience proves otherwise. I'll never buy another Klipsch product and would encourage all to, at least, be very wary.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic headphones and sound terrific, but are poorly made. I have an old set that I bought years ago and after about a year the connection between the headphone jack and the wires failed. I was able to fix it. I bought my son a set in late September, and they have already failed. I haven't yet had a chance to diagnose that failure, but am sorely disappointed with the obvious quality control problems on an expensive item from a well-known company.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have had my share of headphones and X10s are by far my favorite! The are VERY musical, balanced, very well made and work great with any device I have tried them on (iPhones, Galaxies and MacBooks). A solid product! PS. By mistake my X10s went though a washing machine and when they came out the sound was very muted, as expected. I was busy for a few days and was about to order a new pair, and decided to try the old ones one more time. Apparently it took a few days for the X10s to dry up and they sounded great again!!! Try that with a classic headphone design. Armature design rocks!
customer_reviews.author: ALY

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different earphones for running, including having custom earpieces made for my Ultimate Ears Triple Fi 10 headphones and nothing stayed in when sweating until I bought these Klipsch headphones. They are incredibly light and fit well into the ear canal so you hardly know they are there. I absolutely LOVE these headphones for running, and the sound is good too! Update: So, after just a few months the headphones have begun to short out. They do not handle sweat well so I have to take back my recommendation that they work well for running.
customer_reviews.author: pinkymidge

customer_reviews.title: X10 Awesome sound at a much better price!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the S4 earbuds for a while now. I've always been tempted to buy these, but couldn't justify the $350 price tag. But since the X10i earbuds came out with the control pad, these have dropped to a price I can handle. The S4's where great, but the X10's are awesome! The highs and lows are just that much more and really add to the experience. They are more comfortable too and to stay in the ear a lot better than the S4 earbuds. This was definitely worth the upgrade for me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barbret

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent sound quality - might be delicate...we shall see
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Got these for a very good price I thought. For $99 bucks they blow away any other ear plugs I've ever had. Sound quality is excellent! Plenty loud with little distortion. They fit my ear better than any other plug to. The only thing that I am leery of is they "appear" to be a bit delicate....we shall see. I've only had them a few days. I'll know more a month from now on their durability. For now I recommend them highly if you can get them at the reduced price.
customer_reviews.author: Grant M. Holzworth

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable earphones
customer_reviews.text: Part of my rating is related to purchasing these at a deep discount through Amazon relative to what I saw elsewhere. At the large discount, they put my other ear buds to shame (a pair purchased for $100). The sound quality is great. Their best feature is that they stay put in use. They are great to use while running and other activities. Nothing I've used in the past is even close. I would imagine these are far more comfortable when exercising than wearing an oversized set of over the ear headphones a lot of people seemed drawn to.
customer_reviews.author: FJSIII

customer_reviews.title: I own 6 pairs of the best in ears (Shure 535-Westone 350-B&O new in ears -Sennheiser ...
customer_reviews.text: I own 6 pairs of the best in ears (Shure 535-Westone W-30-B&O new in ears -Sennheiser IE-800 and more ) The Klipsch i own 3 pairs . They are the most comfortable if you don't mind in ear . They sit much deeper in the ear canal then all others . On a flight you cant hear anything except Music . I have a pair with me almost a EDC for me Sound quality is truly amazing I don't know how they do it! All types of music they sound great great detail crazy but tight bass. I travel so much in ears are a hobby . I think the Klipsch will be hard to beat!
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend! Better than anything else to sleep in.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, smallest earphone I could find, finally something I can sleep in. I purchased for the main purpose of playing beach waves noise and blocking out the noise from the bar I live above so I can get some sleep-and they work great for this! They sound pretty good, though I am not an expert in this area, seem very durable (have been using same pair over a year now). Yes, a bit pricey but last and perform better than the apple earbuds...at this point I would of gone through 2-3 apple sets anyway so that considered I actually saved $. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ErinE

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several pair of Klipsch IEMs and two sets of speakers form them. I have loved my S4s and S4is but these blow them away! The imaging, the sound stage, the clarity, the tightness of the bass and the comfort are all incredible. It seems as if the musicians are playing inside your head. When I first heard them (from a 24 bit FLAC source) my mouth dropped open. I am amazed by these. Best purchase I have made in a long time! If you find these on Amazon when they are around $90 ( I got them when they were $114), you better jump on them! You will not regret it! Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Fit!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Klipsch speakers since 1980 so I had high expectations. I wasn't dissapointed. Rich, true bass, clear midtones and the crisp high end make these earphones great, perfect for jazz. But that's not why I bought them. The design sold me. The tiny earbuds slip into my ear and stay put. They fit so nice and comfortably I hardly know they are there. No more earache. The buds fit deeply enough to block outside noise well and "seal in" the wonderful Klipsch sound. I'm careful with these earphones and haven't had any problems. The carry box is big enough so I don't have to stuff them in. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: AngieW

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: I listen to all my music to go in the FLAC format, my MP3 player has about 20 options for different sounds in the equalizer function. FLAC does not strips any of the sound during the recording process, you get raw music as it meant to be recorded, therefore you need a great pair of earphones that will handle all the music and will allow you to hear all sounds being played. Well...these earphones do that and more, the isolation features works so well that I used them while flying, you can hardly hear the plane engines run. These are probably the best earphones in the market...Did I mention that I have over 20 different earphones?
customer_reviews.author: Erwin A. Quiroga

customer_reviews.title: Was a gift and the person said these were the best!
customer_reviews.text: I found a review for these on LifeHacker. My husand had tried earphones, one broke, the other the cat chewed on. He always said that what he had used in the past was okay. According to Lifehacker these were good, and they were not wrong. As soon as he put them in his ears he noticed a big difference from the other brands he had used. They were comfortable, the sound was awesome and they were still under $100. The case they came in also can guarantee the cat will not try to ingest them. He rated these 5 stars as I said for comfort and sound. I think i will get a pair next!
customer_reviews.author: netkat

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Used Yet
customer_reviews.text: Klipsch X10i's are the best ear buds I've used yet. I don't consider myself an audiophile but I've gone through a few ear buds and headphones looking for what I consider the best merger of sound quality, comfort, sound isolation, form and function. While other products have sounded better, namely my Bose Triport headphones, nothing beats Klipsch for comfort and ease of use in everyday situations. Whether it's laying around watching a movie or at work crawling into crazy places on an airplane Klipsch x10i's are super low profile, usually my head'll hit something before my earbuds do. This feature alone makes them awesome.
customer_reviews.author: joeylo73

customer_reviews.title: These are the best ever
customer_reviews.text: Yep, pricey. But they are the best I've ever had. I have some cheaper ones of the Klipsch series that work really well, but these X10's are mine and I guard them closely. I purchased them for a 2 week long motorcycle trip where I was the lead. That meant that I needed to be on GPS the entire time we were riding. 10 - 12 hours a day ABSOLUTELY NO PROBLEM, day after day after day!! And they fit under my helmet. 100% one of the best buys for myself ever. Recommended to MANY of my best friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Best ear buds I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are simply the most comfortable in ear buds I've used and I have bought a lot of different kinds. I travel a lot (75%) mostly international and wear music or movies help me fall alseep on the plane. Pretty much any of the silicon bubble ear buds do an OK job of isolating ambient noise, you pay for the quality of the speaker and sound. But in this case the design is basically perfect. The design of these earphones allows me to fall asleep and stay asleep with them in without shoving them down my ears or making them sore. Highlty recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bend Slick

customer_reviews.title: clear, precise sound and a very comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I have spent at least $100 over the past year in earphones that have broken after everyday use. If I would have purchased this item to begin with I wouldn't have been so frustrated. The quality is wonderful and I'm not talking about sound... which is much better than anything else I have purchased before as well. I have no complaints about this product. It has met my expectations for sound reproduction and ease of use. The connection to my phone and Kindle is solid and has even kept my Kindle from hitting the ground recently when I dropped it! The item is great, in my opion.
customer_reviews.author: Miller's High Life

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but HORRIBLE cable noise
customer_reviews.text: I owned the x10 for almost 2 years, I did not have any issues with the build quality. These tiny things fit deep in your canal and isolate outside noise really well. Deep rich bass and overall great sound. I would have kept them if it wasn't for the absolutely unbearable cable noise, I stayed in denial for over a year by ignoring the cable noise but I finally came to my senses and moved on to the Shure se215.
customer_reviews.author: AcMurda

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but broke after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is awesome. Not a lot of bass if you like that. Plenty of pieces so you will find one that fits your ear. After about 3 months my set broke. At first I would get a little static and would lose sound. I would adjust the headphones and they would work again. Eventually they just stopped working. I think the connection to the jack became detached inside. Klipsch took the pair back for exchange. But took them 2 months before I got new ones. So far my second pair has worked for 5 months but I can tell they are started to have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rob R

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but cheap build
customer_reviews.text: These sound pretty darn good for in ears. If you don't already know don't expect any kind of over the ear headphone sound from these. If you like the best sounding headphones you need on ear or over the ear. These are perfect for isolation where you don't want people hearing what you listen to. Great for the gym. I got them when they were only 90$. By far the best in ear for the price. These things have started to fall apart though. The rubber around the base of the bud has started to tear one year later.
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Nice earphones, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Would give it 4 1/2 if Amazon allowed half-stars. Overall I'm very satisfied with these earphones. Unlike the S4's, I have no problem with the cups actually disengaging from the driver in my ears. Very happy with the sound quality and isolation. My only worry is the cord which seems a bit frail for such expensive earphones. However, I've been using them for a few months and no issues. I don't believe though these are worth full retail at $350, however for the price here on Amazon they are a terrific set and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Better fit than other earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I must have a dozen different earbuds by various manufacturers but none of them fit as well as these. The thicker but soft silicon rubber on these tips block out outside noise so well that I rarely take my Bose headphones any more even though I fly at least twice a month. The light weight, shape and tip make for an excellent fit which is one of the keys to great sounding earbuds. Those factors also result in maximum comfort. The sound is very good. These are my favorite earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on sale for about 90 during Black Friday 2 years ago. I have better headphones and earbuds, but I use these almost daily. They have stood up to being wound up and placed in a pocket multiple times. They fit nicely and comfortably in the ear and the sound quality is very nice for this price range. You will get some noise when the cable rubs against your shirt or jacket, but I find most earbuds do this to some extent and I am able to usually block it out. I wouldn't use these for running though.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Shaftkey

customer_reviews.title: Best corded Ear bud
customer_reviews.text: Best corded bud I've ever used. 4 Stars for working out because they're corded. Other than that these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Randy S

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing earphones. The fit
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing earphones. The fit, the sound (I can't explain how incredible the music sounds over-all), the noise isolation is superb, and comfort. I could really go on - but I now own 4 pairs of Klipsch and will forever only use Klipsch so long as they continue to be manufactured ... but these are by far my most favorite of the all of them. So much so and because I am afraid I may not find these again in the near future - I intend to buy another pair as a spare. One never knows.
customer_reviews.author: nautilus828

customer_reviews.title: Great for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set as I had lost the first set on a recent trip. Didn't realize how great they were till I had to fly back from Europe without them. I'm not one who claims to be an audio expert but I can tell you that the klipsch ear buds are very comfortable, easy to sleep with while on a plane. They are not noise cancelling but do a great job in isolating any engine noise. Additionally, they come with a nice leather bound carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Dickster 48

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones; no match for a cat
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked amazingly well for about a year. They sound fantastic (great bass, good noise canceling quality) and despite the negative reviews on here, they held up rather well to normal wear and tear. That being said, I sadly learned today that the cord is not cat proof and can easily be chewed through with the proper set of feline chompers. It seems that while they sound really great to humans, they must taste really delicious to cats. Buy beware.
customer_reviews.author: some_noise

customer_reviews.title: listen to the Klipsch IMAGE S4's and compare
customer_reviews.text: bought the Klipsch IMAGE S4's and was very impressed with the sound,bought the x10's after reading reviews,here is my opinion [I am a part time musician and audiophile]the s4 headphone sounds better with clearer highs and lows,the x10 headphone is more comfortable but sounds like an s4 with a membrane or cover over the speaker,i gave the x10's to my son and listen to the s4's,I tried all the ear pieces and burned in the headphones . I couldn't get that transparent, on the stage feeling with the x10'S.The x10's are an upgrade in comfort and a downgrade in sound.
customer_reviews.author: PDJ

customer_reviews.title: good but Bowers and Wilkins C5 earplugs are better
customer_reviews.text: i have had a hard time choosing between the bowers and wilkins c5 and these. In the end i went with bowers and wilkins. Why? 1. these dont have good bass reproduction 2. volume control is quirky with pandora in iphone. It jumps and goes back and then goes up when all i am pressing is the + button. 3. the mike is too sensitive. gives a lot of feedback from clothes brushing against it, your breathing etc. Pros: 1. Excellent weight, fit. 2. carry case is great 3. lightweight
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: defective upon first use; perhaps my error
customer_reviews.text: Loved the sound and fit, as both were much better than the cheaper Klipsch. On pulling it from my ear the cable separated completely. I don't think I used inappropriate force or anything, and probably defective on manufacture. Immediate refund was offered and I reordered the current model, XIIi instead. Recommend pulling these type buds from the ear while grasping the ear piece firmly, not the cable.
customer_reviews.author: W. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Went through washer and dryer and came out perfectly fine!
customer_reviews.text: Both my boyfriend and I have had these for a few years now and we absolutely love them! They fit great, they're light and sturdy, but most important the sound quality is great! Great bass without poor treble! I have had Bose before and they broke (the wire tore at the bud area) after a month and after switching to Klipsch, I don't think I'll get anything but Klipsch. Originally, I wasn't going to write a review since there are already so many. But, recently my boyfriend's pair accidently went through the washer and dryer and they came out perfectly fine!! So that warrented my review :)
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight, Powerful Bass, Clear Highs
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to spend this much for earphones but have always found Klipsch audio products to be high quality. Let me say, I have not been disappointed with these. They are so light and comfortable, yet the sound quality is amazing. I did have to experiment with the different sizes and placement to find the perfect match for my ears (Note: most earbuds do NOT fit my ears). To my great pleasure, 15 minutes after receiving the package from Klipsch, I was enjoying the sound. If you are looking for light weight, comfortable, and powerful earphones, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Enri

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these headphones for the simple fact that the cable wire had disengaged from the piece that connects it to the ear bud after only 2 weeks of light use. Thankfully, I was able to return them without any issue as a Prime member. I will add that the sound happened to be very clear and strong until it just came apart. Poor quality. I wish you luck with this product. Way too unreliable for me given the steep price!! Klipsch needs to get their act together!
customer_reviews.author: Camper

customer_reviews.title: Sound great and comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: These definitely changed the way I feel about In-Ear Headphones. Most buds that I have experienced were very painful and I could only keep them in for a couple of minutes. With the Klipsch buds I have yet to have any painful experiences. These sound very good, although I would not say they sound better than a good pair of over the ear headphones. I would recommend these to anyone needing a comfortable pair of in-ear headphones when you are in a situation where you can't where over the ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Chafner_0711

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was really skeptical of these headphones just because of the extremely small size and some of the reviews on amazon. The sound clarity on these headphones is amazing on just about everything. It brings to life sounds you wouldn't normally here on regular earphones throughout the songs. I have listened to Bose headphones and these by far are superior. Really glad I picked these up on black Friday. The only downfall may be the thin cord but it seems pretty sturdy and if you take care of them it should be no problem. These are great and don't hesitate to buy!
customer_reviews.author: mumbojumbo22

customer_reviews.title: got a defective set
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are extremely comfortable and sound phenomenal however, the set that I received had a faulty right earpiece that made a harsh vibrating/buzzing noise when playing mid or high range sounds. I just returned them and ordered a second set so hopefully I'll have better luck this time. UPDATE: Just received my new ones. The buzzing/vibrating sound my I experienced with my previous set is is no longer existent. these are by far the best everyday, quality earphones I can imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Henry

customer_reviews.title: Nice but Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Bought these at a Black Friday sale because they were 60 or 70% off, and I was pleased with the results. Impeccable sound and good fit in my ears. These things are so light that I almost forgot I was wearing them. Very good for listening through a nice mp3 player or a tablet. However, these did not last long, and they died after several months. The left side went out completely. Klipsch was very kind, and sent me a brand new pair of X10i headphones as replacements. I've kept those boxed up ever since, as I'm not sure if wearing them to get that good sound is worth the chance that I might break them!
customer_reviews.author: A Concerned Citizen

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable in-ear headphones I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Besides sounding really good, these in-ear headphones are amazingly comfortable. In the past, I could never wear in-ear headphones longer than an hour without it causing pain in my ear cartilage due to a narrow ear canal. With these headphones, I no longer have that problem at all. I can use them all day. Don't let the narrow profile of these headphones fool you. They have great overall frequency response, and surprisingly amazing bass response. They aren't perfect in the high frequency range, but are really great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Best IEM's I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: After playing these for 2 years they just keep getting better and better. Matched up with a FIIO Kunlun(sold on Amazon), to me it.is listening.Nirvana. These puppies are for real and i got mine an absolute steal ($89.99) Easily worth triple that....good stuff.....reallllll.good stuff. The most amazing thing to me is the detail...it's mind bogglingly good..i ain't gettin rid of these puppies for a lonnnngggg time
customer_reviews.author: Ellricngin

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent more than I usually would for these.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute enjoyment listening to these. How they got bass to be this smooth, powerful, and clean in these little things is a technological wonder. After you find the right fitting caps among the five sets they send, be prepared for a sonic feast for your ears. So comfortable you don't even feel them, but the amazing sound won't let you forget you're listening to them. And in what is the greatest tribute from me, I have not put my Sony mdr-v6's on once since getting these Klipsch buds.
customer_reviews.author: mr. oysterhead

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible small, super comfy Audiophile Earbud Headphones!! Absolutely stunning sound, neutral, Aural, clean, crisp, clear. Your music sounds how it was recorded! I Own Image One, and Image S4i's all great but the X10i's are the BMW of Headphones!! Did I mention Comfy, you'll forget your wearing them. Most of my music is CLassical and Opera all in Apple Loseless and the sound is so beautiful it makes you tear up and want to just sit still close your eyes and be serenaded!! Enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair as a present for a family member, as i already own a pair. You will not find a more comfortable In ear headphone than these. They sound phenomenal too boot. Headfi and a couple other sites rave about these being the only pair you can wear for hours and not even realize your wearing them. They are so small. I recommend these to anyone who listens to music for hours without end (at work, home, commute etc). So comfy and more importantly so amazing sounding.
customer_reviews.author: Brophus

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty good expensive earphone, but it dead after one year of use.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Best in ear headphones I own!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest only got these in ear headphones because the price dropped drastically. I don't regret buying these because they are amazing. The headphones give you a comfortable feel and also noise cancellation. Within the package it includes a leather sturdy case for you headphones and an adaptor for the airplane. I suggest you but this item because the quality is really good when when listening to music or watching videos. It also looks really cool!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound cant get a good fit
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, these sound AMAZING. They sound like a concert hall in your ears. They are so light weight and thin, but my ears just can't stand in ear headphones. I can't get a good fit, and they will often loose their seal in my ear to the point where the bass doesn't sound as punchy until I push them back in. I will not fault Klipsch for this, I think i need to go to an audiologist and get a custom fit in ear monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Klaproth

customer_reviews.title: Bloody Marvelous Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have had many headphones over the past year as my 15 pound tiger enjoys destroying them whenever he gets a chance. The x10s are the highest end I have purchased and by far the best -- I have owned Klipsch s4i,s4,s2, Sennheiser CX 300, Thinksound ts01, Sony EX56 and many super cheap ones. By ranking: x10,s4/s4i,Sennheiser cx300, s2, Thinksound ts01, Sony EX56. I was planning on getting the Klipsch s5 rugged pair in hopes my cat would not be able to easily destroy them but the price was right on the x10s so I purchased them instead and am happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - terrible build and no warranty
customer_reviews.text: Not an authorized dealer. Klipsch headphones are known to fail within the first year. Mine did (headphone jack failed now will only play in one ear - another pair I had the wires separated from the ear buds within a year of light usage) and Klipsch won't do anything about it. I've contacted the seller and they will not respond. There are better headphones out there that will last longer and honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: spacius solid sound.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are a sound monster, best I've ever Heard, I've own klipsch x5, m6 pro, aurvana in ear 2 plus and aurvana 3, Apple in ear BA, samsung in ear BA, jbl a3, monster jamz, monster isport, jabra box, and other brand that claims to be good, I have to say this: there is no comparison! Just one issue: handle with care, built quality is too fragile.
customer_reviews.author: marcos garcia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones - best when purchased during Black Friday Discounts...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very comfortable fit Good level of noise cancelling Included carrying case Clear sound reproduction from Bass to Treble. Surprising amount of Bass from earbuds. Cons:None These headphones are everything I would ever need in a earbud. But I would never be able to afford them at retail price. But at the Black Friday sale price (or any random discount that brings the price down to around $100) makes this a very good value. I listen to all types of music including Led Zeppelin, Dream Theater, Miles Davis, Weather Report, Tower of Power, Fela Kuti, Bob Marley, Willie Colon and Hector Lavoe, Tiesto, Allison Hinds, etc. There was a type of music that these headphones seemed out of sorts with.
customer_reviews.author: Shane P

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Have had my set for about a year now and love the sound quality. Probably not for the heavy metal or hip-hop crowd, these are audiophile earphones that bring out every little detail of the music. You will hear every detail of the recording, good or bad. I previously purchased a set of Razers (retail $60) and EarJax Lyrics (retail $150), both are good but the Klipsch bring out details the others can't. Some reviewers have reported that they are fragile, they are, these are premium buds and you need to take care with using them. Mine show no sign of wear, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: markoman

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: although very small in size the klipsch image x10 produces an amazing sound quality.i own many earphone but the image x10 are by far the best. they are very comfortabe and i forget that they are in my ears. make sure to fit the correct earphone cover to the size of your ears, as it effects the sound quality. i also have very high praise for klipsch customer service they fixed a problem i had within two days. i wish many more companies will follow their way.
customer_reviews.author: Nali

customer_reviews.title: The sound is tight, accurate and astounding (especially for the size!)
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of Beats By Dre... these are better! Full range of sound, blissfully devoid of exaggerated tones, these lightweight buds are almost unnoticeable when properly fitted in the ears. While I would not dream of spending the original price for them (nor for any other earphones!) they are really a deal at the price listed here. Klipsch gets the job done with this one. Although they seem a bit insubstantial materially, and sometimes I wish that they had a clip for the ear, they are really exceptional sound devices.
customer_reviews.author: Nicktal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, can't believe the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, can't believe the sound quality. Clear highs and bass that really thumps. Most buds to get bass you have to have volume turned up but these are strong even at low volume. These will be the top of any list in my book.
customer_reviews.author: r farmer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: As a disclaimer, I got these during the promotion when they cost less than $100, down from their retail price of over $300. With that being said, I think this is one of the best purchases I have ever made. Sound quality aside (which is incredible but I'm not an expert so I won't dwell on it), these are the MOST comfortable headphones I've ever used. I didn't think comfort was a big deal, and I kept thinking it was overplayed by the people reviewing the headphones, but it's not. You could wear these for 10 hours and not be uncomfortable, all while experiencing incredible sound quality. These headphones blew me away!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Eye Opening Sound
customer_reviews.text: Theyre not the greatest, but for the price i got these for is the bomb. Theyre very very clear and have a great range not too good with bass though. I loved these headphones until they got stolen so im waiting for another price drop hah. Good headphones ehhh not so bad comfort gets bothersom after a bit, and the cord length and quality will definitely suprise you. Its genuine
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but only when discounted
customer_reviews.text: Long story short: these are the best IEMs I've ever tried. However, if I hadn't bought them for 65+% off, then I would say they wouldn't have been a worthwhile upgrade from my Sennheiser CX 300B MK II Precision Enhanced Bass Earbuds (Black). But these definitely do sound better (to me), come with a (imo) superior carrying case, are smaller/more portable, and look more aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: catsandcows

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional sound, great for running
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They are light as a feather, very comfortable, stay in place while I'm running, are classy looking, block out a lot of the ambient noise, and sound fantastic, better than any other earbuds I have tried. Exceptional sound may not be everyone's thing, but it is important to me. If they were lost, I would buy another pair. For their current ninety dollar price tag, they are an affordable luxury.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: light and small, some wire noise.
customer_reviews.text: I also use the shure headphones with foam tips which I love. the drawback is that it's cumbersone to take off and one frequently. i like the slim design and sound quality of these klipsch. cons: does completely isolate the noise like my shures and i can hear the wirenoise. can be distracting when jogging. i like it because i can take it off and on quicker than the foam tips of my shures, so i prefer using these when i think i may get frequent interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent full range sound with good base clarity
customer_reviews.text: The only problem was finding the right rubber seals for a good fit as, with all ear buds, the seal is critical. Something about the design seemed to make that more difficult than with the Klipsch s4's I had. The presence is outstanding and the reproduction of music is balanced from low to high. Vocals are impressive. Base is not exaggerated and comes through clearly as distinctive notes when the ear buds are properly placed.
customer_reviews.author: dbhOhio

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three sets of these earphones -- for my wife, for me, and a replacement. Each has failed in less than a year. The connection between the cable and the earphone failed in each case.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Center Control button has a problem
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty much satisfied with the X10i’s except for one major issue I’m having with the single button that controls the pause, play forward and play previous song. Yes I’ve seen the tutorial on their wed site (they make it look so easy) and have tried numerous times to get the same results but time after time, 9 out 10, the result is a negative. The only thing I can get it to do successfully is pause and play.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable earphone out there
customer_reviews.text: At the current price it's a great bargain and I would highly recommend the Klipsch X10 before they run out. You can believe all the good reviews and with over 500 reviews there isn't much else to say. I've owned these for 4 months and these are the most comfortable earphone out there and should fit any sized ear. They come with a nice case for storage and sound great......
customer_reviews.author: Zaneco

customer_reviews.title: the best and lightest headphones that ever been in my ears
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, the best and lightest headphones that ever been in my ears. I am blessed to have ever used them, though they are so small, they fell out of my pocket at work and I didn't notice. Too expensive to replace, but perhaps tax return time next year I may purchase another set if I can find them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and... Wow!
customer_reviews.text: The sound of these earbuds redefine the earbud category for me. The sound is not only acceptable, but it exceeds any over ear headphones I have ever owned and not by a small margin. Granted I haven't owned any $800 over ear headphones, but I have some nice ones. Second, these are the first in-ear earbuds that have ever been adequately comfortable. Until these, I have always tossed in-ear earbuds after a short time do to discomfort. These are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Victor L. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality but just too small
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many different brands of earphones. The sound quality of these are excellent, however, they are too small for my ears and keep falling out, even using the largest available earpiece. And while its hard to know how large my ear canal's are in comparison to an average person's, every other earphone I've had I have not even had to use the largest earpiece--I always use a medium sized one. Very disappointed, they're basically useless to me as they fall out every 10' while walking. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Excelent
customer_reviews.text: The same as the newer X10i except without the annoying inline volume control. Not as much of an improvement over my $80 Klipsch S4 earphones as I expected but it is an improvement. As other users have noted the low end is less pronounced than with the S4s. I believe these earphones are simply producing a more accurate sound. While this model has been discontinued for a while, if you can find them in stock pick them up.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: High recommendation, and Goodreads Inc provided this quote from Anthony Burgess:
customer_reviews.text: “Oh it was gorgeousness and gorgeosity made flesh. The trombones crunched redgold under my bed, and behind my gulliver the trumpets three-wise silverflamed, and there by the door the timps rolling through my guts and out again crunched like candy thunder. Oh, it was wonder of wonders. And then, a bird of like rarest spun heavenmetal, or like silvery wine flowing in a spaceship, gravity all nonsense now, came the violin solo above all the other strings, and those strings were like a cage of silk round my bed. Then flute and oboe bored, like worms of like platinum, into the thick thick toffee gold and silver. I was in such bliss, my brothers.” ― Anthony Burgess, A Clockwork Orange
customer_reviews.author: Kisok

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear sound
customer_reviews.text: I picked the Klipsch X10's up a few weeks ago, and I have to say these are the best set of in ear headphones I have ever owned. The sound that gets pumped into my ears is second to none, everything is crystal clear, if it wasn't for the music playing you would never know you had them in your ear, they are super comfortable to wear. If I ever lose these I will be buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great quality headphones that fit comfortably inside my ears. In comparison to my Bose IE2's, these headphones offer complete noise isolation (which can be great for private listening, though not necessarily public places e.g. subway). I also enjoy their sound better. The seal offers a great crisp bass and quality mid and high ranges. Wire feels a bit cheap, but the headphones offer a two year warranty so I imagine it holds up. Will update if any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones if they're on sale.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for black Friday, satisfied with how they work, but would not purchase if they're not on sale. Pros: - Very light. - Highs and mids are very very clear. Cons: - Lacks in base. - Not really a con, but these are so light and small, sometimes I'm scared that I'll push them in to my ear canal and they'd be stuck there forever! Recommend? Yes, but only if they're on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin G.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Quality.
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are by far the most comfortable ones I have ever used. They also block outside noise incredibly well unlike my old apple earbuds. The sound is clean and refined. Because it blocks outside noise so well and sounds so crisp, I actually listen to my music at much lower volumes than I used to. My only complaint about this product is it falls out of my ears fairly easily, and it's pointless to use them while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Realistic Sound
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the high quality sound these earphones produce. Very well balanced and faithful reproduction of the music and vocals. Clean and clear sound without being overpowering in any one range. It does an excellent job of isolating external noise. The only quibble is that it is difficult to see in low light which earphone is for the left and right ear.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie D

customer_reviews.title: Great - but fragile
customer_reviews.text: I love Klipsch earphones but they are fragile. I usually have to replace mine every two years or so because the wiring starts to break and then only one side works. This happens EVERY time. Sometimes it is fixable, sometimes not. But they are so good I just keep buying them. I think I am on my 4th pair in 10 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Britt at Large

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple other in ear monitors like these from Shure. These compare vary favorably. They are very light, I'd guess about half the weight of my others. Sound quality is very good especially when you factor in you're getting such a small and light package. I don't think I'd buy them at their full retail price of $3xx but when on sale in the sub two hundred dollar range they are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Great base not overwhelming excellent highs and balance as would ...
customer_reviews.text: Great base not overwhelming excellent highs and balance as would expect from klipsch don't wait another minute order from Amazon best price going hear the sound and enjoy the best price around thanks Amazon for the opportunity for me to afford gold standard klipsch earbuds rock on brothers 😃
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Huston

customer_reviews.title: X10>5xS4
customer_reviews.text: these x10 headphones blow every earphone ive ever tried out of the water. klipsch took everything i love about their s4 series, fine tuned it, refined it, shrunk it down to a tiny size, and finally put it into the X10. these things are amazing! they must be made with a mixture extraterrestrial technology and black magic. real life sounds pale in comparison to the depth and precision of the x10's.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Calvillo

customer_reviews.title: At last comfortable ear buds
customer_reviews.text: After going through many brands of ear buds, all have broken with frayed wires, malfunctioning speakers etc. All were fairly comfortable , bur none could be worn laying with one's head on a pillow. These buds are by far the most comfortable. Good sound spectrum. Bass is not overwhelming but they handle classical selections very well. Connection points and cord rugged and appear to be designed to eliminate stress points that result in frayed wires. The Design of the speakers fit comfortably in one's ears and are void of hot spots. Very happy with purchase , looks like they will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Nice small earphones, I waited until the price was at its lowest to try them. They are decent. One has to really screw them into your ear canal but, although they are slightly larger, I prefer my Shure earphones which offer much better noise isolation as well as sound performance. Had I paid full price for these I would be upset but for what I paid I am okay with them.
customer_reviews.author: kayak99

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even greater customer service and warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Really high quality earphones and amazing service. One of the best earphones I have had. It's an upgrade from Klipsch S4. I love the warranty - had issues with the earphones 2 years after purchase from Amazon. I called Klipsch and shipped my earphones to Klipsch and they sent me an upgraded version! .
customer_reviews.author: Pal

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I listen to classical.opera and jazz amd thr Klipsch Image X10i handle the accuracy and very demanding dynamic range of each. You hardly know that you are wearing them, as they are so light and well designed. I often use them on the NYC Subway and they have no problem blocking ambiant noise - much better than 'noise cannciling' phones. The controls work fine on my iphone ans wjile listening to music. Strongly recomented.
customer_reviews.author: Howard F. Mandel

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful acoustics, not too heavy on the bass
customer_reviews.text: I bought a X5 initially and used it for two years, before the connector was loosened from overuse. Bought an X10 immediately after, and used it for another year, before my baby girl chewed through its cord. Bought a second piece after that, at tremendous discount if you compare it with the X10i. The reason I stuck with Klipsch X series: The ear buds fits my ears extremely comfortably, feels weightless and most of all, sounds wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: KY

customer_reviews.title: Wow, simply wow.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers no doubt have already vocalized my thoughts better than I could hope to, as I am merely an aspiring audiophile rather than an actual one. In any case, these are the first noise-isolating earphones that actually stay in my ears, and I would argue for the size, the sound quality is right on par with (if not superior) to that of my Bose QC15s.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome & Light Weight!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these against a pair of Etymotic ER-4Ps that cost twice the price and decided on these. Seriously, to me they sounded much better. Also, one thing about these that should not be overlooked, they are extremely comfortable! Very light and easy to wear for extended periods of time, that's a great feature for long work days...
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good sound from earbuds.  Not sure I would pay much more
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I got these ~$300 headphones on sale for ~$90. Was it worth the $90? Meh... maybe. Are they worth $300? No way. Cable feels cheap. Does not feel durable or pliable. The case included is very nice. Sound quality is good. I wish I would have gotten the newer x10i version. But, I will not pay anything over $100 if the quality is comparable to these
customer_reviews.author: gjmcc50

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones at the price!
customer_reviews.text: I would never have paid $300+ for single driver headphones, but for less then $100 these are fantastic. Not as much punch to the bass as the s4's but very clean and accurate. I can hear the bass notes very low rather then the brain rattle. Also no harshness in the highs. I have sensitive ears and sometimes the s4's could sound harsh but these are beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Rex McArtor

customer_reviews.title: I like these more than my Shures
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 different pairs of Shure in ear headphones over the past few years that have cost between $100 and $300 and I'm a much bigger fan of these than I am of any of the Shures. The size, weight, and sound of these will make them my go to pair for when planning on wearing headphones for any extended period of time. Only time will tell on the enduring quality of the Klipsch, but seeing as how none of my Shures have lasted more than 2 years I can't see how the Klipsch quality could be any worse.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing ear buds
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing ear buds, excellent sound quality. Unfortunately some of the black rubber part between the cord and ear bud is falling apart and I fear they may not hold up much longer. A high price tag, but well worth it! I am not sure if there is some type of warranty in effect to help me get them fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, so I'm not crazy to pay several hundreds dollars for any earbuds.I got the Klipsch for $90. I like a lot the electronic music and I got a huge FLAC and mp3s collection. I had only Koss portapro (cheap but very comfortable), I was very happy with them for many years, but now I discovered X10 sounds better. X10 has not the boomy bass of Koss portapro, but the x10 quality sound is far superior to Koss if you use FLAC or mp3 with high bitrate, if you use low quality mp3 then save money and buy cheaper earbuds. I can recommend to anyone if the price is around $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis

customer_reviews.title: Really good headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice headset. They are by far the smallest and lightest in-ear headphones I have ever seen. They are incredibly comfortable to wear. The sound is really nice. The only reason I give it 4 stars and not 5 is because I would like a little more bass. The bass is adequate, but for this price range, there are other options, such as the Monster Turbine Pro Gold, that have way more bass. If you prefer a more flat sound, though, then these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: rgtute

customer_reviews.title: Fine headphones, fine price.
customer_reviews.text: The sound coming from these little gems is amazing. Clean, crisp, and voluminous bass that still humbly allows the rest of the sounds to stand out in a warm balance. Detail is phenomenal as well. I carry these everywhere I carry my phone, and I use them to listen to music, mix music, play games, watch movies, etc. Couldn't be happier. I upgraded from the S4's though, and only a tiny bit of difference exists between the two. Before that, I owned the Bose IE2 for a year, and these headphones are not only cheaper but better in every way. If I were to lose these headphones, I would buy another pair. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Macris

customer_reviews.title: great sound
customer_reviews.text: great sound and fit. the light wires dont pull the plugs out of my ears like some of the other sets. I am worried about the longevity of the thin wires though and am hesitant to use them everywhere. The ear plugs come in various sizes and fit my ears better than the average headset.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Cullen

product_meta.title: Klipsch Image X10 Noise-Isolating Earphone (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingNot only is it the world's smallest and lightest full-range in-ear headphone design, the Klipsch Image fuses lifestyle, technology, and fashion to offer a personalized fit and deliver a precision-tuned acoustic experience. IMAGE earphones utilize translucent patent-pending Contour Ear Gels that are anatomically designed to accurately fit inside the human ear canal. These soft, oval silicon tips reduce ear fatigue as well as provide an amazing seal for excellent noise isolation and increased bass response. Because ear canal measurements vary, each IMAGE model comes with five different ear gel sizes: small, medium, and large single flange designs as well as small and large double flange designs. Exclusive extended-frequency KG926 balanced micro-armatures deliver a superior acoustic experience with all the delicate accuracy you have come to expect from Klipsch. IMAGE earphones feature aluminum bodies finished in beautiful anodized copper and sleek, streamlined black "tails." Aside from aesthetic appeal, these flexible "tails" reduce cable stress and serve as an acoustic dampener to minimize cable noise.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Introducing IMAGE noise-isolating earphones from Klipsch. Not only is it the world's smallest and lightest full-range in-ear earphone design, IMAGE from Klipsch fuses lifestyle, technology, and fashion to offer a personalized fit and deliver a precision-tuned acoustic experience. Status symbol products such as the iPod® have played a major role in making technology fashionable in recent years, making it necessary to develop a stylish audio accouterments that can bring better sound to in-vogue listeners. 


Klipsch IMAGE--when you're as serious about sound
as you are about style 

Complete Comfort

IMAGE earphones utilize translucent patent-pending Contour Ear Gels that are anatomically designed to accurately fit inside the human ear canal. These soft, oval silicon tips reduce ear fatigue as well as provide an amazing seal for excellent noise isolation and increased bass response. 

Because ear canal measurements vary, each IMAGE model comes with five different ear gel sizes: small, medium, and large single flange designs as well as small and large double flange designs. Such variety allows these earphones to fit more of the population than the competition. 

Complete Immersion

Inside these compact gems, you'll find over 60 years of audio expertise ready to let you hear what you've been missing. Exclusive extended-frequency KG926 balanced micro-armatures deliver a superior acoustic experience with all the delicate accuracy you have come to expect from Klipsch. 


The world's smallest and
lightest full-range in-ear earphones Complete Allure

A must-have audio accouterment for fashion-forward listeners, IMAGE earphones feature aluminum bodies finished in beautiful anodized copper and sleek, streamlined black "tails." Aside from aesthetic appeal, these flexible "tails" reduce cable stress and serve as an acoustic dampener to minimize cable noise. 

Complete Satisfaction

Furthermore, Klipsch has gone to great lengths to ensure the long-lasting durability of IMAGE, up to and including its 50-inch-long vinyl cables. The company has added appropriate strain relief at every cable connection point to help prevent wire damage, while also putting IMAGE through extensive "real world" testing. 

Complete Features and Added Frills

Klipsch IMAGE earphones have true-to-life sound immersion for all activities: from travel to exercise to just relaxing and listening to your favorite music. Their uniquely small, fashionable design provides unparalleled comfort and an amazingly accurate fit. With their exceptional durability they can go the extra mile with you wherever you may go with any number of portable devices such as iPods, the iPhone and virtually any device with a headphone jack. These earphones come with a faux-leather carrying case and compact pouch, a 1/4-inch adaptor, an airline adaptor, five sets of ear gels and an ear gel cleaning tool.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,190 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
